original_content: |-
  <h2 class="wp-block-heading">Meet with a VA recruiter</h2>



  <p>Explore a new career at the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) while you attend exciting conferences across the U.S. Our recruiters will be attending several events in November and December to share more about available opportunities and how a career at VA can have a big impact on Veterans. </p>



  <p>If you’re All About Veterans like we are, plan to attend one of the following events:&nbsp;</p>



  <ul class="wp-block-list">
  <li><a href="https://www.rsna.org/Annual-Meeting" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Radiological Society of North America (RSNA)</a> from November 30 to December 4.</li>



  <li><a href="https://www.hematology.org/Meetings/Annual-Meeting" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">American Society of Hematology (ASH)</a> from December 6 &#8211; 9. </li>
  </ul>



  <p>Read on to learn more about how to register for these events and meet with a VA recruiter.</p>



  <h2 class="wp-block-heading">Advancing Innovation: Imaging the individual </h2>



  <p>This November 30 through December 4, join the global radiology community in Chicago, IL, to explore the future of precision medicine and inclusivity at RSNA 2025, which aims to explore new frontiers, push boundaries and bridge the gap between personalized care and global health disparities. </p>



  <p>Be sure to stop by VA’s booth (#1248) to learn more about how your skillset can make a difference in the life of a Veteran.&nbsp;</p>



  <p>You can register for this event <a href="https://www.rsna.org/annual-meeting/preparing-to-attend/pricing-and-registration" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">online</a>.</p>



  <h2 class="wp-block-heading">Discover cutting-edge research </h2>



  <p>Join fellow hematologists and health care professionals from December 6 &#8211; 9 in Orlando, FL, at the 67th ASH Annual Meeting and Exposition. Attendees will have access to hundreds of educational sessions and will be able to network with top researchers, trainees and clinicians. </p>



  <p>VA recruiters (Booth #1909) will also be there and ready to discuss how you can join the mission of caring for our nation’s Veterans. Stop by to learn more!&nbsp;</p>



  <p>You can register for this event <a href="https://sso.hematology.org/app/ash_ashspargonew_1/exk8a0b9zgJevksgY357/sso/saml?RelayState=&amp;%%3d&amp;RelayState=url%3Dash%2Espargoinc%2Ecom%2Fash25" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">online</a>. </p>



  <h2 class="wp-block-heading">Work at VA </h2>



  <p>Join our recruiters at these upcoming events and jumpstart a meaningful VA career. Learn more and apply on <a href="https://vacareers.va.gov/job-news-advice/fall-into-a-new-career-at-these-upcoming-events/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">VA Careers</a>.</p>
original_markdown_body: |-
  ## Meet with a VA recruiter

  Explore a new career at the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) while you attend exciting conferences across the U.S. Our recruiters will be attending several events in November and December to share more about available opportunities and how a career at VA can have a big impact on Veterans.&nbsp;

  If you’re All About Veterans like we are, plan to attend one of the following events:&nbsp;

  - [Radiological Society of North America (RSNA)](https://www.rsna.org/Annual-Meeting) from November 30 to December 4.
  - [American Society of Hematology (ASH)](https://www.hematology.org/Meetings/Annual-Meeting) from December 6 – 9.&nbsp;

  Read on to learn more about how to register for these events and meet with a VA recruiter.

  ## Advancing Innovation: Imaging the individual&nbsp;

  This November 30 through December 4, join the global radiology community in Chicago, IL, to explore the future of precision medicine and inclusivity at RSNA 2025, which aims to explore new frontiers, push boundaries and bridge the gap between personalized care and global health disparities.&nbsp;

  Be sure to stop by VA’s booth (#1248) to learn more about how your skillset can make a difference in the life of a Veteran.&nbsp;

  You can register for this event [online](https://www.rsna.org/annual-meeting/preparing-to-attend/pricing-and-registration).

  ## Discover cutting-edge research&nbsp;

  Join fellow hematologists and health care professionals from December 6 – 9 in Orlando, FL, at the 67th ASH Annual Meeting and Exposition. Attendees will have access to hundreds of educational sessions and will be able to network with top researchers, trainees and clinicians.&nbsp;

  VA recruiters (Booth #1909) will also be there and ready to discuss how you can join the mission of caring for our nation’s Veterans. Stop by to learn more!&nbsp;

  You can register for this event [online](https://sso.hematology.org/app/ash_ashspargonew_1/exk8a0b9zgJevksgY357/sso/saml?RelayState=&%%3d&RelayState=url%3Dash%2Espargoinc%2Ecom%2Fash25).&nbsp;

  ## Work at VA&nbsp;

  Join our recruiters at these upcoming events and jumpstart a meaningful VA career. Learn more and apply on [VA Careers](https://vacareers.va.gov/job-news-advice/fall-into-a-new-career-at-these-upcoming-events/).
source: Veterans Affairs Pension Program
source_url: https://news.va.gov/143562/fall-new-career-upcoming-events/
summarized: true
title: Fall into a new career at these upcoming events 
topics:
- Employment & Job Support
---

The U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs is hosting a series of events focused on career opportunities for veterans and transitioning service members this fall. These events aim to connect them with employers and provide resources for job searching. Key events include hiring fairs in various locations, virtual workshops on resume building and interview skills, and networking opportunities with industry professionals. The VA emphasizes the importance of these events in helping veterans navigate the job market and secure meaningful employment. Employers from multiple sectors will be present to engage with attendees, offering insights into available positions and the hiring process. The schedule of events is designed to accommodate different needs, ensuring that veterans have access to valuable career resources and support as they transition into civilian life.
